title: Who is Martin Bashir ahead of his appearance on X Factor: Celebrity?
text:
Martin Bashir was inspired to sing on X Factor: Celebrity after brother’s death (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Journalist Martin Bashir is due to make a strong impression on the The X Factor: Celebrity judges tonight, as he brings Simon Cowell to tears with the story of his brother’s tragic death.

After he performs L-O-V-E by Nat King Cole for his opening audition, Bashir will share how his late brother, Tommy, suffered from muscular dystrophy and died aged 29.

Martin will be seen saying: ‘The real reason why I’m here is that I’m one of five children, and my precious brother Tommy was born with muscular dystrophy.

‘When you grow up with a child and you fight over toys, and you’re aged four, and he never fights back, then by the time he’s 13 he can’t feed himself, you feel you have no excuse for turning down opportunities.’

Ahead of his emotional appearance on the show tonight, here’s what you need to know about Martin Bashir and his career as a journalist…

Who is Martin Bashir?

Bashir, 56, is a British television journalist from Wandsworth, London.

He’s perhaps best-known for conducting an interview for Panorama with Princess Diana about the breakdown of her marriage to Prince Charles and for his ITV documentary called Living with Michael Jackson.

It was his interview with Princess Diana which shot him into the mainstream public eye in 1995.

Since then, he worked as an anchor on ABC’s Nightline, and worked as a political commentator for MSNBC.

In Bashir’s 2003 documentary on Michael Jackson, it was revealed that the Smooth Criminal singer shared a room with children.

Dieter Wiesner, Jackson’s one-time manager, told The Sun after the musician’s death that the documentary ‘broke’ the pop star.

Dieter added: ‘It killed him. He took a long time to die, but it started that night. Previously the drugs were a crutch, but after that they became a necessity.’

Currently, Bashir, a Christian, works as the BBC’s Religion Editor.

He shares three children, Phoebe, Samuel and Eliza, with his wife Deborah Bashir.

As for his musical side, he released a reggae album in 2010 called Bass Lion.

X Factor: Celebrity kicks off Saturday on ITV at 8.35pm.
